column4: Anyone know much about installation options using the alternate cd?
what is your exact question?
Can I do the installation more 'interactively'. I think there's a menu under there that most do not see with base install, extra applications, grub install etc.
check the oem install
Do you think that's it?
yeha think that's the option you want there is an explanition someplace on ubuntu site about what the options do
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CommonQuestions#head-f7a1accd6e8e139773b9b334f964e209b6d9ff84 <<< That's the nearest I can find to any info on this. Can you do any better>
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Ubuntu_OEM_Installer_Overview?highlight=%28oem%29#head-f7a1accd6e8e139773b9b334f964e209b6d9ff84 what the oem install looks like
Very good. Thanks.
you just go to the ip in a web browser or do you need sharing
I want the apache server I've installed on my ubuntu laptop to be accessible to the windows laptops. We would need to be on the same network for an ip address to have any meaning, right?
not really
OK. Both laptops are in the same room, and both have wireless cards. What address do I go to on the windows one to access the apache server?
the ip address of the apache server
OK. How do I know that?
umm ip should tell you on the apache server

Do you mean 'it' should tell me? The apache server(on my laptop) is on 127.0.0.1. I can access it on my laptop, but 127.0.0.1 on the windows machine is the loopback for the windows machine. How do I access the ubuntu laptop?
127.0.0.1 is the loopback for any network
Right. I'm not sure you've understood my problem, but I don't know any other way to put it.
I do understand it the apache server must have an outside ip 192.xx.xx. or so
Wouldn
no just requires a wireless card on the laptop
Thanks for the help
